Docs.summary:
SqlCredential provides a more secure way to specify the password for a login attempt using [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] Authentication.
SqlCredential is comprised of a user id and a password that will be used for [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] Authentication. The password in a SqlCredential object is of type .
SqlCredential cannot be inherited.
Windows Authentication () remains the most secure way to log in to a [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] database.
